website_summaries.verdict: The Canon Pixma MX860's auto-document feeder, large LCD screen, and quick print speeds are sure to increase your productivity, but it also includes plenty of software to nourish your creative interests. At $199, this multifunctional printer earns our recommendation.

customer_reviews.title: Finally, after tinkering for an hour.
customer_reviews.text: Setting up wireless defeated me until I connected the printer by Ethernet cable to an Airport Express set to join my network. Voila, the Canon MX-860 appeared in Sys Prefs:Print and Fax referred to by its MAC address (00.1e.8f.76.5b.4), Airport Utility only shows USB printers so ignored the Canon. Nonetheless, everybody was happy and printed away. So operating in bridge mode Airport Express is providing the wireless connection. Interestingly, the previous owner of the MX-860 couldn't ever get it connected without a cable but replaced the Pixma with the new MX-922 which became wireless instantly indicating that Canon has improved something.
customer_reviews.author: tomnet

customer_reviews.title: No More Canon No More All-In-One
customer_reviews.text: Got the dread B200 error, possibly indicating some problem with the print head. As a result: Lost time, missed deadlines, no more faxing, scanning, copying or anything. Death trap in a box unless you've got backup, live next to a 24/7 Walmart, don't have any other priorities or a life or ... BTW: Tried to call Canon's customer service -- # OUT OF SERVICE # and navigating online services is a nightmare. That's REALLY LOW! These guys must REALLY hate their customers! Other than that -- worked well albeit with a steep learning curve -- more time wasted since I will not use their products again.
customer_reviews.author: Charles

customer_reviews.title: AVOID - FATAL ERROR DUE TO PRINT HEAD (B200 error)
customer_reviews.text: Well, it lasted for 3.5 years, but I'm not sure if that's bang-for-the-buck. A month ago, after purchasing this printer in 2009, a "B200" error appeared on the screen, preventing the printer from DOING ANYTHING (printing/scanning/faxing). This B200 error SEEMS TO BE DUE TO a print head burning out, but even after replacing it (which costed $90, a rather expensive part, don't you think?), no resolution. Fortunatley, I bought this printer for $146 in 2009. I see the current price is around $400. That's just ridiculout. So, as much as I like Canon products, DOOOOOO NOOOOT BUUUUUY THIS.
customer_reviews.author: JA

customer_reviews.title: CANON PRODUCT
customer_reviews.text: My machine is out of date now....but any Canon machine is worth the money. They sell for a price worth the product and their customer service is outstanding. Even when it is out of service, they are great. For ten bucks they trouble shoot and if the problem isn't fixed? No charge. ANd believe me, one day they spent a good two + hours trying to figure out my problem...and yet no charge. I really needed a new printer....and thus was what I got. I still have excellent service and it works very nicely. I will buy Canon as long as this remains the fact. The service techs are polite, positive, courteous, sometimes funny, and always helpful.
customer_reviews.author: reuben

customer_reviews.title: You win, you lose
customer_reviews.text: I've always been a fan of Canon products. I've used their printers for years, including the i850, i4200 (still my favorite printer!) and the multifunction MP530 (my favorite multifunction), MX830 and the MX850. I bought the MX860 for the wireless functionality. I find this is the first Canon product I would not recommend. The wireless printing speed is incredibly slow, either from Mac or PC. Printing through USB is faster, but still far slower than previous models. The new ink is quickly used up and it's expensive. These ink cartridges are not commonly found other than on-line. All-in-all, a real disappointment. I did get the wireless connectivity I wanted but gave up much more in exchange.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Wyatt

customer_reviews.title: So far, so good
customer_reviews.text: I've had this printer since Feb. 2009 and I've connected it to my home network consisting of 3 Mac OS X computers and one Windows XP box. No printer faults yet. The drivers installed without problem on all four of these machines, but installation was easier on the Macs. The standard black cartridge (Canon 220) gets used up faster, so make sure you have spares of the black and the color. I think Canon, like all the other ink jet printer manufacturers, makes more money on the replacement ink cartridges than the printer itself. The photocopier and scanner work relatively well. Bottom line, this is a good printer for home use and for light business use.
customer_reviews.author: RG

customer_reviews.title: Printing Ease
customer_reviews.text: I've had the Pixma MX860 for a year now and it has been money well spent. I needed a quick replacement when my Epson Stylus R2400 began having printing issues. I've never been a fan of any HP product - I stopped using their cheaply made, unreliable products several years ago. The Pixma has filled the gap and the results have been nothing less than excellent. 8x10 prints are stunning, tonal quality is superb and the ink cartridges have outlasted their competitors. I do miss the larger sized paper abilities of the R2400 but what the Pixma does, it does very well. I cannot comment on the fax capabilities as I don't use that feature, likewise for the copy feature.
customer_reviews.author: Photohombre

customer_reviews.title: Mixed Feelings
customer_reviews.text: Hardware is excellent once setup correctly -- exactly what I expect from Canon. Wireless has been functioning flawlessly. That's usually the Achilles heel of wireless printers. However, documentation is carelessly done. It's like a restaurant that serves ugly plates. A sure sign of trouble in the kitchen. The documentation and website support are so lacking that it makes me think that Canon is in a downward spiral. The documentation is a patchwork of cut and pastes from previous generations, often nonsensical. Looks like there's real trouble at Canon's printer division. The lack of good documentation will make some non-vanilla installs into a marathon.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Salita

customer_reviews.title: Canon PIXMA MX860 Wireless Printer
customer_reviews.text: Wow, I've had this printer for a good two-three or more years. Works good, can make some racket now and then. I think it's gonna blow up. Only two things I dislike about it, it goes through the ink and seems to take forever to print something. Meaning the printer thinks for awhile, then spits out the printed pages. As for the ink, it tells you long before you run out, that you are really low on ink. Not very accurate, or a ploy to sell more ink. Other than that, it's been a great printer. Used every feature of this printer at least weekly.
customer_reviews.author: Online Addict

customer_reviews.title: New drivers available for the Canon MX860
customer_reviews.text: This is my third Canon multifunction printer. Overall the performance to me is excellent. The scanning speed is very fast. After reading the comments about the difficulty of setting up the wireless network printing for the printer, I decided to just hard wire the printer until Canon fixed the problem. On March 27 the new drivers arrived on Canon's web site: [...] I can't comment on the problems encountered by others, but with the new drivers, at least for Vista, the installation was easy and straightforward. Keep in mind that you will have to install the software on each computer that you want to access the printer.
customer_reviews.author: Advocate

customer_reviews.title: works great.
customer_reviews.text: This was easy to set-up and has worked smoothly for me. I'm pleased with the color photo quality. The fax and copy functions are simple to use and get the job done. I don't use the wireless capability, just plugged it straight into my router. Complains that it's low on ink, but I ignore it until it actually says a tank is empty. Tanks seem to get "low" really fast but then take a lot more time to actually empty, so maybe not quite the ink guzzler I first thought. After a few months of regular color printing (about 100 or so 8"x10" photos on matte presentation paper), I'm now replacing the ink tanks for the second time.
customer_reviews.author: D. Gardner

customer_reviews.title: VERY PLEASED
customer_reviews.text: I live overseas and received my Canon in surprisingly a short period of time. Amazon has always shipped products we've ordered, quickly. The Canon was easy to setup, though I took a bit longer when I didn't read I needed to be connected to my computer by the USB cable for initial setup. Once pass that small hurdle, the software installed easily and the setup for wireless went smoothly. We have been very pleased with the scanner and color printer, though I wish it printed faster, it' s not something that would put me off from purchasing this printer again. It is a big bigger then the picture suggests, but overall no complaints.
customer_reviews.author: bluesy

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Printer
customer_reviews.text: This is the second Pixma I have purchased (the first I had to put into storage prior to a move to the US). My first was excellent and so is this model. It is easy to setup and install. I have printed from all areas of my home and with the copying and scanning all output is of an excellent quality. I have seen the printer in a small office and the staff use it extensively for faxing and commented that it is excellent. I would recommend this product to anyone setting up a home office or small office, the features, ease of setup and installation, ease of use and final product is excellent - and it's wireless!
customer_reviews.author: L. Edwards

customer_reviews.title: Great machine for the money
customer_reviews.text: My only complaint with this machine is the auto paper feed while scanning. It does not function well on my machine. It is almost like the rollers loose their grip on the paper and it "paper jams." I have found if I am scanning using the auto-feeder I have to attend the machine and push the paper through. I have never had a successful scan run with multiple sheets of paper with this machine. Everything else works great. C ould be just my machine. Could be a design problem. Not worth sending back at this point.
customer_reviews.author: dave higday

customer_reviews.title: great printer few minor cons
customer_reviews.text: I have not had this long but it works really well so far. Pros: scans very fast, very quite compared to the HP I had before. Multiple paper input trays. Goes to sleep when idle. Scan to PDF creates searchable document. Paper output tray automatically opens if closed when printing starts. Scans and prints multi-sided. Feels like a solid machine. Print quality looks good. Cons: Cannot send, view or control fax from computer. Too much Canon software to install. Does not auto select ADF for scan inputs. Network set up a little complex/convoluted even on a Mac, appears to be Canon proprietary network software and process. The machine is bigger than I expected
customer_reviews.author: phenotype

customer_reviews.title: Works well, replaced my old Pixma IP400 with it
customer_reviews.text: The main reason I went for this printer was it's wireless capabilities. I had a few issues with the Mac drivers provided not being Snow Leopard compatible, and then the ones downloaded from the website didn't work so well either. Through googling, I figured out a workaround and got it set up. Now all my wireless Mac laptops can print directly to the printer without having to have a shared network computer that hosts the printer, a definite plus. Easy to use, and the print quality is what I'd expect from a Canon printer. It's not a color laser printer, but if you're looking for a compact all in one office machine, this is a good choice.
customer_reviews.author: Brent Deitrich

customer_reviews.title: Good Features. Poor speed.  Poor Quality
customer_reviews.text: Printer has a good feature set, but the implementation is fairly poor. As a printer: Good print quality. Average print speed. Multiple paper jams, especially when attempting to print double-sided documents. As a scanner: Again good quality. But VERY SLOW. Would not recommend for anyone routinely scanning documents or photos. Overall quality/cost : Poor. Bought the printer just over a year ago, now it's broken and won't scan, won't print. Bought it for $130 and spent at least that much on ink for just over a year of light use. Although I'm a Canon fan (especially their cameras), I will be looking for another brand of printer.
customer_reviews.author: William Keller

customer_reviews.title: Great printer for high volume for several years
customer_reviews.text: Great printer. The Canon PIXMA MX860 has been a great workhorse of a printer for me for 4 years now. Works great. I love the duplex printing and the duplex scanning. I haven't had trouble with pages sticking together as other reviewers have noted. I use the 'fast' print setting often and as a result don't use the ink quickly which makes printing affordable. If I eventually have to upgrade, I would go with the same printer in a newer version because this one has been reliable, good quality and fast printing for years.
customer_reviews.author: Bibliophile

customer_reviews.title: Good value. Nice MFC.
customer_reviews.text: I'm mostly using the scanner, but I bought because my old-age HP printer died. I like Canon. The sheet-feed feature is very nice. Does a very good job with scanning documents. Haven't tried photos yet. There's a fixed negative area which should make that easier. Device is easy to talk to (Win 7, Vista, and XP in my house). I hardwired it on the network, but it's supposed to do wireless also. Holds a good amount of paper. On-screen commands needs too many button pushes, but it's not that bad. It's big, but they all are. Had it for a few months. I like it. I'd buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: John R. Welch

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed; returning it
customer_reviews.text: There are several nice things about this multi-function unit and I really do like its scanning capability and PC interface (much MUCH better than a similarly priced HP). I had no problems with set up or functioning. My concerns and complaints are that it is very slow to print and - as other reviewers have noted - it gulps ink like crazy. I've printed fewer than 500 pages (less than 25% coverage) and the "big" black ink cartridge needed replacement. This was purchased for my office and I'm returning it. I was contemplating one for my home but I'm so glad I didn't order another.
customer_reviews.author: Texaswomyn

customer_reviews.title: So far much better than our HPs.
customer_reviews.text: Update March 20th. INK CONSUMPTION. Still on first black (220) ink cartridge. By using "fast" and not "standard" print quality, I get about twice as many acceptable pages. Also by going beyond "ink low" and even beyond "ink may be out", I get many, many more acceptable pages. This replaced an HP Officejet; we also have a HP Deskjet. Never could get Officejet documentation. Deskjet has "installed" itself 32 times in 12 months and, being online, HP is monitoring our printing. So far very happy with Canon; only question is how much ink will cost.
customer_reviews.author: ander

customer_reviews.title: Great Machine
customer_reviews.text: I bought this from Amazon almost one year ago, and I waited this long to see how it really functioned. I love this printer. The price of the ink is excellent, and as much as we print, lasts much longer than I expected. The colors are vibrant, and it's fast, and very easy to operate. I will say the wireless set up is a pain, but just take it one step at a time, and you will get it done much faster. This is my second Canon, and as far as I am concerned, considering price, ease of operation, color, price of ink, etc., I rate this overall a 5.
customer_reviews.author: LK Kelley

customer_reviews.title: good product
customer_reviews.text: It is what I expected. great print quality. duplex document scanning is a big plus. It wont duplex scan legal though which I was disappointed but I don't do that much legal so it is ok. Scan quality is great. Scanning wireless and printing wireless is really good. Can even attach a USB drive to it and scan PDF and Pictures straight to that and then rename and file later. Over all very satisfied. I have had Canon flat bed scanner and a separate printer for years so I knew the quality would be good. Now I have them all in one plus extras.
customer_reviews.author: Lee M. Thompson

customer_reviews.title: Canon Pixma MX860
customer_reviews.text: Somewhat complicated to setup, but functions perfectly after the setup. The setup was complicated by my having transitioned to Snow Leopard prior to purchase. The CD that came with the multifunction did not work for this reason, so I had to do a manual setup using the Snow Leopard compatible drivers and programs on the Canon support site. The scan function did provide a scan that when emailed was too blurry for printing. This happened even with multiple attempts. Other than that a great Canon product. The wireless functionality is wonderful for the 3 Macs in the house.

customer_reviews.title: This is a GREAT printer for a small office on a Budget!
customer_reviews.text: I like the duel paper trays, auto duplexing, and individual colored ink cartridges (keeps ink costs a little lower). It is easy to set up and easy to use. The only real con I can think of is refilling the ink cartridges is a little difficult. I don't know about the faxing feature as I use an online service. But I would assume it has the same quality as the rest of the printer. I have used this printer in my small office for about a year and love it!!! I would most definitely buy another one without hesitation. It gives you so many options as far as printing, scanning, and copying.
customer_reviews.author: Denise L. Richter

customer_reviews.title: Good printer for price
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this printer at about the time I had to replace the accompanying computer. Set-up was fairly easy but I could not print. I used Canon's email help service but their advice did not help in getting the unit to function. The "manual" that came with the unit was pretty incomplete. Finally, after a lot of "fooling around" with changing settings etc., I got things working properly. The printer now works very well and I am very happy with it. It is somewhat slow in starting up but probably no worse than a lot of other brands.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas E. Potter

customer_reviews.title: Great printer
customer_reviews.text: Replaced previous Canon MP830 just because. This printer warms up much faster. Fits much better on desk. Lower profile a plus. MX navigator for scan, print photos is better organized than previous. It scans very quick with great results. Easy two side printing and they moved the photo paper from the bottom tray to the rear paper holder so paper does not have to bend while loading to print. I use it with a Mac and could not be happier. Amazon pricing with Prime was outstanding. All thumbs up!
customer_reviews.author: W. Doty

customer_reviews.title: Do not Install Setup Disc on NEW i Macs
customer_reviews.text: I have an Apple i Mac and was told NOT to use the accompanying set up disc ,but to go to Canon's web site and download the software. This saved me a lot of time as the set up disc would of crashed my OS system which is Snow Leopard. The printer is wireless and thus far is all that it is billed to be- an excellent 3 in 1 device. The scanner is very slow but adequate. My desk is much less crowded without a fax machine and scanner! Well worth the money!
customer_reviews.author: Wayne Old

customer_reviews.title: Elegant printer
customer_reviews.text: The Canon MX860 is a very nice looking printer and provides excellent print quality. I wasnt quite prepared for the physical size but it's okay. The setup for USB connection was quite simple and took a short time. I am running Windows 7 and the drivers are supposed to be available on the Canon support site but I couldnt find them. The Canon support desk is only available during bankers hous so I havent been able to speak to them concerning wireless connection. Still unable to get wireless printing to work on a Windows 7 system. I tried it on a Vista system and it worked great. Very impressed with the MX860, just need help with wireless connection.
customer_reviews.author: N. Blanchard

customer_reviews.title: Easy Windows 7 setup - even for a computer novice.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this on amazon about a week ago because it was on sale for $114 with free shipping, and the reviews looked good. I set it up today......the wireless setup was easy. I was terrified of setting this up, as I am just not a computer person. But, it was EASY. Haven't printed much yet, but what has been sent to the printer has been great. It makes a bit of noise, but less than my old HP. The papers printed were great. Very happy so far!!
customer_reviews.author: JJGandyDancer

customer_reviews.title: Prints fast - Takes a long time to get ready
customer_reviews.text: It sputters, clicks, clacks, and carries on, but when it finally gets things together, the print comes out quickly. Not a problem for large print jobs, but if you have to go through this each time you do a half-page job, doing a even a few such jobs can slow you down. The remainder of the functionality is great. The unit was easy to set up. I had it running wireless within an hour of unpacking it, so I have not had to find out how good Canon Customer service is. I also don't know how long the ink reservoirs last. At this point, I am pleased with my purchase of this machine.
customer_reviews.author: Philip Reuter

customer_reviews.title: Great all around printer, fax, copier - easy to set up and use.
customer_reviews.text: I've only had this a few weeks, but am very satisfied with it so far. It was easy to set up and works on my wireless network at home, accessible by 3 different PCs. Very helpful to be able to feed in a set of double-sided pages and fax them, or copy them. Nice to have 2 paper sources (rear feeder and bottom tray). Auto duplex is also super convenient. As far as ink use, only time will tell. But I've bought replacement cartridges for other printers on eBay, non-OEM, never had problem, and bought a couple of sets for this printer already (haven't had to use them yet). Bottom line, based on a few weeks of use, highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Howard

customer_reviews.title: Fabulous all-in-one printer!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect, crisp print jobs, fax, or scan every time. Difficult to tell the original from the copy. Out of the box and easy to install. If you are not wireless it is one of the few printers that includes the printer cable! The online Cannon manual is a little convoluted; a simple, printed "how to" reference would have been more helpful. Some reviewers complained about ink usage; simply use your "print quality" settings as needed per job and you will have extended ink usage. By far the best printer I have EVER owned.
customer_reviews.author: Spexis

customer_reviews.title: The Canon Printer
customer_reviews.text: I work at an airport and we own two of these. They are so easy to set up and they are easy to use. We were going through HP printers every 8 to 12 months and over a year later I'm stilling using my Canon with no complaints. This is a great machine and it is very reliable. My only complaint is that copying is a little slow initially, but I can deal with that. At least it works all the time. It was a bit difficult to add to our network, but I'm not good at that stuff.
customer_reviews.author: KJ

customer_reviews.title: Replaced old Canon printer
customer_reviews.text: Was on sale for $90? Can't go wrong. Does everything. We had a MP760 for 4 years and the print head went out. Ink for new printers is expensive ($50) which makes printers almost disposable. I use bulk ink and refill the cartridges. I had to buy a reset tool as new ink cartridges like the ones in the MX860 have a chip in them that has to be reset if the ink is refilled. This all-in-one also allows read/write on the flash media.
customer_reviews.author: M. Ward

customer_reviews.title: garbage
customer_reviews.text: A waste of money. My prior canon printer just stopped working after about 2 years. We bought this and it is quite hard to set up the wireles s to work with windows and mac. the fax, scan and other features work less than 30% of the time. The software is bulky and just garbage. Ink runs out after about 40 pages and is quite expensive. I also did not know that ink had an expiration date. I plan to never buy another canon again.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. Anonymous

customer_reviews.title: Great multi function machine for home office
customer_reviews.text: I researched multi fuction printers for home office use, and this printer was the one with highest ratings elsewhere. The most wonderful aspect of this printer, for me at least, is that it's WIRELESS. Yep, it communicates with my iMac, MacBook Pro, etc. through the wi-fi in my house. One less cable! The speed is fast. The print quality is fantastic! I would definitely recommend this multi function printer for home office use.
customer_reviews.author: Brian P. Freese

customer_reviews.title: This thing is huge.
customer_reviews.text: I like this printer, don't get me wrong. But if you don't need the fax, document feeder, or two-sided copying (like I didn't) then save yourself $40 and get the Canon MP620. I had a little trouble setting up the wireless, but Canon Tech Support is good. They guided me through it and I was printing wirelessly in no time. Scanned photos, look true to their original. Don't be fooled by the guy talking about the scanner. He's trying to save documents in the scanner. I save them to my computer.
customer_reviews.author: oneluv

customer_reviews.title: Awesome printer- great wireless, only really big- measure first!
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE this printer! The wireless feature is incredibly handy especially since it's really big. I mean REALLY big. Like wouldn't fit in the printer area on my desk so we had to move it to the top of a file cabinet, but with the wireless capability this works great! Excellent print quality, easy to set up, super easy to use. I love this printer! It only lost a star for being so huge! I would measure your space before you buy it!
customer_reviews.author: SCS

customer_reviews.title: Great printer for price
customer_reviews.text: Very satisfied with the quality of this printer. So far I have used all the features except for the fax as I have had no need for it so far. The photos printed off my memory card were excellent, even large size prints. Scanner and copier both worked well and were very easy to use. I have it set up on the USB port at the moment so I have not tried the wireless. The product arrived ahead of schedule even so close to Christmas!
customer_reviews.author: Donna Engelman

customer_reviews.title: Though hugh, this MX860 tops all other printers I've owned
customer_reviews.text: I've mostly owned Epson and Lexmark printers over the years all of which got pretty heavy usage and this MX860 has features and a quality most of the others lacked. So far, the ink cartridges are not that expensive and seems to last as long if not longer than what the others did. I'm most happy with the automatic feed for the copier which is my first. I'd recommend it in a minute but remember it is bigger than most printers.
customer_reviews.author: Bill Gaston

customer_reviews.title: Excellent All In One
customer_reviews.text: I have a small home business and so far love this printer. I replaced an HP All in one which started giving me problems shortly after installation and only lasted a year and a half before totally not working at all. Also the HP kept giving pop-up messages that I really couldn't be bothered with. The Canon does what I ask it to, without any problems or pop-ups. With so many printers to choose from I'm glad I purchased this one.
customer_reviews.author: Soop

customer_reviews.title: Printer Fine, setup pfui
customer_reviews.text: Nice Printer, but the WLAN setup is like rocket Science .... Is like back to the Future .... Why not have a Menu to Search Network and then put in the Passwort at the Printer .... You have to connect the Printer via LAN with your router and the setup everything over your internetbrowser ... Oh man, this Printer is pretty Heavy and how stupid is this !!!! This Printer is not Plug and Play .... Or print ;O)))
customer_reviews.author: Freakkater

customer_reviews.title: Sucks ink like you won't believe!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this printer in January of 2010 and have been immensely disappointed. This all-in-one sucks ink faster than I have ever seen before, and each cartridge (there are 5 of them) costs approximately $12 to replace. If the ink is out in even one cartridge (doesn't matter which one) you cannot use the scan, copy or fax functions of this machine. Very counterintuitive and seems like a money grab for Canon. Absolutely do not recommend this machine to anyone unless you have an unlimited ink supply. I am going to throw this machine in the trash, as I can't even justify giving it to Salvation Army.
customer_reviews.author: B. Jenkins

customer_reviews.title: Now my 4 sons want one too!
customer_reviews.text: Great machine! Does everything but sing and dance, and it might do that too since I haven't learned all there is to learn about it. Print quality is great. Fax works so easily and quickly. Scans quickly. Automatic duplex feeder is so sweet! I haven't had to replace the ink yet, but rated it a 5 anyway, because whatever it costs... it's worth it. Everyone that sees it swears it'll be the next kind they buy!
customer_reviews.author: Mary Ann Rausch

customer_reviews.title: Major ink waster
customer_reviews.text: Consumer Reports rated the MX860 a top choice. Wrong! Even if you NEVER print in color, the color ink will run out every few months. Canon says every time you turn this printer on it cleans ALL the color heads. So, you will buy all the color cartridges frequently even though color is never used. If you have money to waste, okay. My HP never had this issue. So much for Consumer Reports.
customer_reviews.author: William D. Funk

customer_reviews.title: This is the One to Buy
customer_reviews.text: From start to finish, a great buying experience. Canon's customer service is wonderful. Call product information before you buy and they answer all your questions. The printer is great - installing the ink cartridge is easy - print quality is excellent. This all in one really does it all. Hint: The paper tray is on the bottom in a pull out drawer - just in case you have difficulty finding it. Hight recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Joan

customer_reviews.title: canon mx860 printer
customer_reviews.text: This printer is great simple to use and easy to hook up. I have windows 7 so I needed to go to Canon web site and download the program for it to run on. Im not a computer expert so I called Canon tech support and they walked me through it very helpful and stayed on the line till the process was complete.Prints fast, very quiet,and fax is really fast.For the price this multi function printer is a great buy.
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly Crowley

customer_reviews.title: MAC OS Snow Leopard user
customer_reviews.text: Super easy to set up. If you have the slightest bit of computer knowledge, then logging onto Canon USA's webpage and downloading the latest Snow Leopard software is a breeze. The box included software doesn't support the latest 10.6 Snow Leopard... Thankfully, Canon already figured this out... I'm running my MX860 wireless on my network. Took 5-10 minutes at the most. Ink cartridges could've been a little bigger... but we aren't heavy printers. THANKFULLY I bought through Amazon and not retail... saved at least $50! Good looking printer... modern silver/black finish... light weight. If you have any problems connecting your printer, call Canon's toll-free helpline number... that's what they get paid to do.
customer_reviews.author: R. Pell.

customer_reviews.title: GREAT Machine, EVEN BETTER support from Canon
customer_reviews.text: Machine does exactly what it says, quality is fabulous and Canon's support is absolutely the best in the tech support business. Slightly tricky to set up on network and I am not sure why I had to install (or download and install) quite so many components but this machine performs flawlessly The only reason I didnt give it 5 stars was because it replaced an equally fabulous Canon MX850 and the cartridges (which arent all that expensive) are absolutely tiny. They are half the size of those in the 850
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan

customer_reviews.title: Canon All-In-One
customer_reviews.text: I've used this printer for a couple of years now and am very pleased with it. Changing out the separate ink tanks is easy, and the back paper tray provides many useful options (photos, addressing letters, etc.). The only con to it is that the bottom paper tray is sometimes a little tricky getting it to slide back in, but this is an occasional minor nuisance, certainly not a deal breaker.
customer_reviews.author: Dave Gerhardt

customer_reviews.title: Unacceptable issues with this printer
customer_reviews.text: I bought this printer a year ago, and in that time have found three factors which make it a terrible product. First, the wireless setup is ridiculously difficult and problematic. Secondly, it uses ink like crazy. The color cartridges practically disappear overnight. Third, it takes forever for it to calibrate itself, and then further minutes for it to process a wireless download before printing. The quality of the printed pages is good, thus a couple of stars, but the high price combined with the factors listed make it a horrible product. I'm replacing mine, it's too aggravating.
customer_reviews.author: Meiguoren

customer_reviews.title: Canon PIXMA MX860
customer_reviews.text: Printer hardware easy to set up. Manual wasn't a lot of help, but the software installed flawlessly. Wireless and all printer functions worked without any Vista OS adjustments, unlike the H/P printer that I originally purchased and eventually returned after 2 unsuccessful hours on the phone with HP Customer Support. The output tray is a little clunky but functional. Photo quality and features better than the wired H/P it replaced, and it worked out of the box, without any frustration or calls to Customer Support. Haven't navigated through all of the Cannon icons installed on the start-up screen, that would be another area that could be improved, but overall, a great value for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Gunpoint

customer_reviews.title: Won't just print...
customer_reviews.text: I'm really shocked how hard it is to just print using the MX860. On several occasions we've just given up and heading to the local coffee shop to print out in a rush. The problems with the printer are that it often believes there is no paper when there actually is some, it goes through ink incredibly fast, does not work with our wireless network, and none of this could be solved with several phone calls to customer support. Unfortunately we did not use the product within the return window, otherwise it would have gone back.
customer_reviews.author: powder8

customer_reviews.title: Canon MX860 Printer
customer_reviews.text: Really like this printer, can't beat wireless. I do not agree with some people regarding slowness or loudness - I have not found that to be the case at all. Nice quality on pictures, but the colors aren't perfect. I suspect I have to spend some time tweaking my choices. I think this printer can produce better pics and I will continue trying. I don't need the fax so I can't comment, the scanner works great and I love having duplex printing. Nice software also (Easy PhotoPrint EX). I did experience when I printed labels the page shifts slightly. My biggest concern is I still can't get the printer to recognize my IBM Laptop...any suggestions would be greatly appreciated.
customer_reviews.author: Karen K

customer_reviews.title: THis was really a bad one
customer_reviews.text: 1. Came with three different sets of instructions-- clear as mud. 2. Networking would not set up even after multiple attempts. Contacted Canon and got back a 38 step process! 3. Before I could go through the networking hell, the printer began saying that there is stuck paper-- but there isn't. This was my third Canon, but my last. My history with printers continues to be horrible. I simply do not understand the many positive reviews all these printers receive. If I get one year, I consider myself lucky. Why no upgrades in usability and reliable performance? Why the continued dissing of Mac users? Why is ink so expensive? Bye, Canon
customer_reviews.author: duchy

customer_reviews.title: Wireless set up was easy
customer_reviews.text: I was almost scared to try to set this up on a wireless network (after reading some other reviews) but the instructions were fair-to-good and I set up a usb desktop with XP, a windows 7 laptop wireless and a Vista laptop wireless, all work great. Allow nearly an hour to set up each as the software really loads slow (or is really, really large). Everything else seems to work as expected.
customer_reviews.author: Wayns World

customer_reviews.title: so far so good
customer_reviews.text: Had the printer for a few months set it up wireless in my home network, so far scanning is as good as any big machine I have tried. Software is good although not like to be forced to open it every time I turn the computer on. Once added to the network works with both Windows 7 and windows vista, have not tried it with Apple yet. for the price i consider it a very good printer.
customer_reviews.author: JC

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised...Sweet printer for the $$$
customer_reviews.text: Have PC's and Macs using it in the house. So sweet to sit on the couch now with the laptop and be able to print something to my office when I need it done. Only slightly confusing to set up because it is a little too detailed to cover every combo. Works very well and is fast and pretty. Got it for a great price which I have not seen it anywhere for since buying a month ago.
customer_reviews.author: J. Fleming

customer_reviews.title: Good MFP
customer_reviews.text: Print - good Photo - good Wireless - good Works fine on Windows, scan and print. The bad - cannot find 64 bit Linux print driver. I was able to find the 32bit print driver on Canon Germany. However the scan driver does not work for me on wireless. It looks like Linux scanning will require it to be connected over ethernet or direct connection over usb.
customer_reviews.author: H. Hwang

customer_reviews.title: not worth your time
customer_reviews.text: my wife and i have spent hours trying to set up the wireless connection between our computer and printer. it is extremely difficult to use. also, the cannon rep on the phone told us that they will charge us $100/hr after your one year warranty if we would like their help in setting it up. overly complicated and poorly made.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron

customer_reviews.title: ugh
customer_reviews.text: I have gone through a few printers in my life. This one, hands down, beats all for s-l-o-w-n-e-s-s!! Hey, I'm an Instant American. I don't want to wait 2-3 minutes for one page to print out. Not impressed so far. UPDATE: The scanner died within one year. I tried everything, to no avail, to resurrect the thing. My two-star rating still stands :(
customer_reviews.author: young croney

customer_reviews.title: Decent printer -- drinks ink -- uses color ink for black printing
customer_reviews.text: Overall, this printer is about what you pay for. No compatibility problems using it with both Mac and PC. The duplex is nice, but it is SLOW. However, the biggest annoyance to this printer is that it uses color ink to print grayscale. How does that make any sense? I don't want to print ANYTHING in color, I just want simple documents and to only have to buy their (very expensive) black ink. No dice. When the color cartridges run out, it stops working and won't even print grayscale. Knowing this I wouldn't have bought this printer.
customer_reviews.author: Willarleys

customer_reviews.title: A a dependable and sturdy printer.
customer_reviews.text: I've owned several Canon printers and have always liked the way they perform. This one is no different. It's very dependable and sturdy and I would recommend Canon printers to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Dan Griego

customer_reviews.title: Best printer I have ever owned
customer_reviews.text: I'm in the IT business so I have worked with quite a few printers in my days. I have owned this printer since June 2009 and it still works great. It is very well engineered and prints fantastic. The sheet feeder and duplex printing work well. The scanning, faxing, and networking work well also. There is a delay sometimes before it prints, and sometimes it won't print Google maps (not sure why, other than perhaps a printer driver issue). Other than that, I have never had a problem with this printer. It is really nice to have a device that just works well, unlike some other devices that I own.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: just what I wanted
customer_reviews.text: This was remarkably easy to set up. I'm not an electronic expert by any means, but I was able to set it up, including the wireless connection to two desktop computers and a laptop, with no real difficulty (just be sure you remove everything orange -- tape, protective covers on the cartridges). I would say the cartridges are lasting longer than the ones on the HP that this replaces. My only complaint is that the paper tray is tucked in so you can't tell that you're running low just by glancing at it. Not a big deal.
customer_reviews.author: Perle des Antilles

customer_reviews.title: Poor Usability; Flaws in Detecting Paper
customer_reviews.text: Have given up on Canon printers because of various problems with this one: --Ink runs out rapidly. --Networking function is clunky; doesn't work well. --Had a serious sensor problem; was unable to detect that paper was loaded. --Very poor, bloated and clunky software. --Wireless scanning and other connectivity did not work well. --Printing quality was poor.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Duplex printing, copying, & scanning !!!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased October 2009. Excellent duplex functionality, best consumer all-in-one I have ever used. Wireless setup flawless, reliably picks up laptops in range time & time again. Did I mention the duplex auto document feeder? Consider scanning all your invoices & statements, storing them digitally, & getting rid of all that paper. An excellent buy.
customer_reviews.author: AG2T

customer_reviews.title: Great printer for home office
customer_reviews.text: I have loved this printer and owned for a little over 5 years. Printed beautifully, but was a bit of an ink hog. That is why I gave it a 4 start rating. Intuitive and easy to set up and maintain. It did play out after 5 1/2 years without any warning though. I went to purchase again (or a similar model) and now they cost as much as a laser printer, therefore I'm upgrading to laser.
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly DuPree

customer_reviews.title: I Love My Canan All In One Printer!
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a good printer that also copied, scanned & faxed, and when Amazon sent me a Special Offer on the price of a Canan All In One, I jumped at it! When it arrived I was a little overwhelmed at the thought of installing it as it looked complicated. But I called Canon's Technical Help number and the Customer Service guy stayed with me through the installation, showing a lot of patience, and it was a breeze! I just love the product and it does all I want & more!
customer_reviews.author: Robin K. Gorichky

customer_reviews.title: Good - Not Great
customer_reviews.text: The disk heps you setup network printing quite easily, but every time I startup I have to re-establish my printer's network connection. The prints are nice but slow. I have a Canon Pixma i4000 that prints faster. I love the document feeder for scanning and copying big files. The printer is not as bulky as I thought but it is big.
customer_reviews.author: R. Sablan

customer_reviews.title: Consultant / Semi-Pro Photographer / Digital Artist
customer_reviews.text: I have only had the Canon Pixma MX860 for 2 days but have put it through the tests. Printing photos from my Canon 50D camera on pro paper at high resolution gives a photo lab result. Have printed 30 ADA presentations for our City and saved enormous time with duplex printing. Both ADF scanning and flat bed scanning were super fast in all file modes. Puts my HP, Lexmark and Epson printers to shame. Next on my list, the Canon Pixma 9500 MKII. Would recommend this to everyone.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel P. Gray, Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Completely Satisfied
customer_reviews.text: The printer works perfectly for my needs. Wireless scanning and printing. I don't do a whole lot of printing or scanning, but when I do I appreciate the versatility this printer provides. Since it's wireless I can have it out of sight at all times since my usage varies quite a bit. I had to call tech support to have them walk me through some set-up steps (which I found out was due to my own ineptness) and they were very helpful. I was pleased with their service. I own a Mac and they have plenty of personnel available to answer Mac questions. Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: C. Farmer

customer_reviews.title: Great printer
customer_reviews.text: This is definitely one of the best printers that I've used so far. It handles all of my printing needs, and it can be used wireless and with multiple computers. I would recommend this printer.
customer_reviews.author: User_22

customer_reviews.title: great printer very easy to set up
customer_reviews.text: everything the technical writers said worked. No problems with wireless, it worked on the first attempt. A little noisy when first turning on. I liked the feature for placing the ink cartridges, it let you know when they are seated correctly ( no guess work) like other printers. Awesome machine for the price from AMAZON!
customer_reviews.author: D. Wolfe

customer_reviews.title: Canon Wireleess printer
customer_reviews.text: Fairly difficult to set but a delight to use.We use it as a light duty home office printer/fax/copier .It produces crisp copies ,the colors are bright .It replaced a very expensive office printer .We are completely happy with the features and print quality.The wireless feature is a definite plus and works perfect
customer_reviews.author: J. Slater

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Printer
customer_reviews.text: Wireless setup straight forward. Packaging nice. Amazon Prime is great. Bought this for my mother and good for the occasional print. Ink cartridges are cheap! Very nice scanning functionality. Fax works well with my VOIP provider (BELD). Print quality is very nice. Have not tried photo printing on this yet.
customer_reviews.author: R. Moy

customer_reviews.title: A super printer
customer_reviews.text: Got just what I was hoping for at a great price. Good news is that I was able to attach wirelessly from one computer and via ethernet off the modem/router to another. Got terrific assistance from help group at Canon to accomplish this. Have noticed that the ink tanks are getting smaller (vs. old mp530) Was very successful in refilling cartridges for mp530. Suspect the same will be true for this printer (sometimes one must drill in from the side, fill the cartridge and close hole with hot glue).
customer_reviews.author: K&KS

customer_reviews.title: works well and good value
customer_reviews.text: my older canon multi-purpose's fax application suddenly didn't work any longer, so i bought this one. am not using it wirelessly, but it has that capacity. it's still a big machine, but works well. have only had for a few months - hopefully the fax will last longer than the last one. good buy for money.
customer_reviews.author: bartwin

customer_reviews.title: Cannon MX360 Printer
customer_reviews.text: I replaced a HP photo smart all-in-one. The Hp wasn't an all-in-one as it didn't have a fax feature. The Cannon does. The ink is reasonable and does a credible job with photos. In all I am very satisfied with the Cannon printer. The HP gave up the ghost in 5 years with light household use, it remains to be seen if the Cannon will continue reliable service in the future. For now it is the best printer I have ever owned. By the way as usual Amazon came through with excellent delivery time and service (good job).
customer_reviews.author: Mountain Mike

customer_reviews.title: overall very good
customer_reviews.text: everything seems excellent except these two things: 1. i have no idea why i can't do wireless scanning. i had to go to office max and buy a thumb drive just to transfer photos. very annoying considering i was rushed at the time and i have an exceptionally fast wireless network at home. 2. it's a bit bizarre today to have cd-rom based setup. this was a hassle for me in particular because i have a macbook air (no cd rom) other than that, it's been excellent and i would buy it again and recommend it to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan Locke

customer_reviews.title: Great wireless AIO
customer_reviews.text: The Canon Pixma 860 does it job great and I love going wireless from anywhere in the house. The quality is extremely good. The only complaint is you cannot directly fax from a file using a Mac. You have to print the file out and then scan it back in. That's nothing major but should get corrected.
customer_reviews.author: Ron T

customer_reviews.title: watch out
customer_reviews.text: Unit was complicated to set up. Lots of tape to remove and throw away. Unit failed the first time I sent a Fax. Canon replaced it in a couple of days but they substituted a refurbished unit for the new one I purchased. My complaints went unanswered to this day. That's not right, Canon
customer_reviews.author: rokko

customer_reviews.title: Works great wirelessly; big; am searching for alternative OCR and scanning software
customer_reviews.text: Great scanner that has it all. Wireless feature is great for letting multiple computers print to the shared printer, without one of them having to be on and connected the entire time. Certainly a large device; seems larger than it needs to be, but who am I to say? Automatic document feeder with automatic duplexing make this a dream machine! Wish the scanning software were a bit more robust and the OCR a bit better, so I'll be searching for replacement software, but other than that, a great piece of technology!
customer_reviews.author: Jason E. Mock

customer_reviews.title: Great Printer at a great price
customer_reviews.text: I love this Canon printer. It is quiet and fast and works great for a small Ebay business. My only complaint is that it I cannot figure out how to use 1/2 sheets of paper but I haven't really looked that hard. You can individually replace the ink colors and that is nice. I purchased a non-Canon replacement black ink and it was Very inexpensive and worked fine. I would say ink use is average. I would purchase this again but keep in mind that it is quite large!
customer_reviews.author: Patrice Hunt

customer_reviews.title: great printer hard to setup on mac 10.6
customer_reviews.text: This is by far the best printer I have ever owned. The problem is setup on a mac running 10.6. All drivers are on the apple web site but all of the navigator and setup software is on the canon web site. with no clear instructions on how to go about set up. Canon needs to update software package to include all software to be able to run on snow leopard. It took me about 3 hours to figure it out but once I got it on one mac it was easy to setup on other mac's. I would recommend this printer to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Jk mac

customer_reviews.title: MX860 EXCELLENT PRINTER
customer_reviews.text: This printer is extremely worth the money... I paid 129 for it! Had an HP Officejet 5510xi and had to junk it. The HP have horrible software and are expensive inks. I LOVE THIS PRINTER! Has more features than I could have thought some are hidden so it makes it a nice surprise to find. Good quality construction heavy duty! Auto duplex is awesome and has more features on the alone than most other printers! Excellent buy!!!
customer_reviews.author: The Big Guy

customer_reviews.title: Easy and Trouble-Free
customer_reviews.text: This has been a dream machine for all our home office needs. Paper never seems to jam; controls and menus are clear; faxing is easy. MUCH better machine than the Kodak all-in-one we had. Canon's website information for driver downloads could be a little more user-friendly, but it's OK.
customer_reviews.author: S. J. Felter

customer_reviews.title: Does everything I want in a printer
customer_reviews.text: I bought this printer primarily for all-in-one, duplex printing, batch processing and bluetooth wireless capability. Set up was a little rough in some areas but was completed in less than an hour. I now have 4 computers in my home which can share this printer over my wifi net. I've always been satisfied with the quality of Canon products. I think the ink price is very competitive. I'm very pleased with the product. Can't beat it for the price. Received in 4 days with regular shipping.
customer_reviews.author: J. Gordon

customer_reviews.title: Pixma MX860
customer_reviews.text: This is the 3rd Pixma printer we've purchased for our business. They are rugged, dependable printers with a lot of good features. For someone who has average or above average computer experience they are pretty easy to use, however the MX860 was purchased for someone who isn't that comfortable with computers and doesn't have much patience. The steps you have to take to scan, then email or print a document or picture are overwhelming for him and as a result he won't use that feature. Also, as with all inkjet printers, the replacement ink can be a bit costly. Overall I do like this printer, though, and would buy one again.
customer_reviews.author: S. Judy

customer_reviews.title: Printer
customer_reviews.text: Printer is pretty solid. Is defintely better than the others I have owned. Uses pretty much ink and the scanning seems to act up sometimes. Found that when scanning if you use the console it doesn't work... if you use the software then it always works. Strange but as long as you know it doesn't really matter.
customer_reviews.author: Greg

customer_reviews.title: replace the ink cart. once and the thing took a crap
customer_reviews.text: when i bought this canon i thought i was buying a brand name and for the amount of times i really use it should last me forever ,well longer than 2 yrs . you would think .well it didn't . i replace the cart. once and right after that it stop working and the screen said to bring it to a repair center. just what i need something else to take care of. they are not that forth coming with info about who is an authorise dealer and where there located still have to do more reseach.not worth the it. find another brand to purchase ,very disappointed
customer_reviews.author: Steven Smith

customer_reviews.title: Flawed Ink Usage
customer_reviews.text: For the price, its a wonderful printer. But what canon does not tell you is that this eats up ink like a beast, and ends up costing a lot. Even printing black and white documents uses your color cartridges ($45 for a set). I have printed absolutely no color documents so far and my yellow, cyan, pink cartridges are empty. Choosing grayscale printing does not use only the black cartidge. Do investigate other options.
customer_reviews.author: N. Ahmed

customer_reviews.title: Its ok but for I think you can find comparable for cheaper.
customer_reviews.text: It's a pretty good printer. You have to have the printer turned on before you print. That may sound like common sense but many printers turn on automatically when you print from your computer. I started to just leave it on for convenience but that seemed to cause the wireless to loose connection so I had to go through the set up process again to reconnect. The photo print quality is good as well as the scanner quality. I haven't used the fax so I cant say how that is. My only complaint is that I've seen comparable quality and functionality for less money.
customer_reviews.author: Rambo

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Value for the money.
customer_reviews.text: It seems amazing how much functionality one gets for the money in these all-in-one devices. The Canon MX860 delivers excellent performance. I have had a number of Canon Pixma series printers and found they all delivered good results. I like the separate ink tanks. They do seem to have a fairly limited life expectancy, but given their cost, they are economical. Still, I am not entirely comfortable about creating so much land fill -- it might be better if they cost a bit more and lasted a bit longer. In summary, however, the MX860 is a fine printer/scanner/copier etc.
customer_reviews.author: Calvin Opitz

customer_reviews.title: MX860 & Snowleopard
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the product on Amazon.com. Arrived in 3 days. I was concerned about the compatibility issues with Snowleopard because of all the online comments I read. The CD that came with the purchase was useless. I called Canon, the tech support directed me to the 4 crucial drivers to download from Canon website. The printer works great: wifi, scanner, duplex, speed of printing are all as described in the product specs. I can even choose the quiet mode in printing. Canon technical support is great, the product works really brilliantly. Had it up and running in less than 30minutes. I have yet to test the photo printing and fax features so no comment on those.
customer_reviews.author: HlTsummer

customer_reviews.title: Good All in one machine.
customer_reviews.text: Like this very much. Except for the following issues. * Initially had some problem in the network setup (both LAN and wireless). Had to call the customer support and the support person helped to set it up. * I have Ooma telephone connection. So having problem to have the fax working with it. Not able to test so far. May not be an issue with this machine. Have to find what is wrong in my telephone connection.
customer_reviews.author: Pravin K. Balasubramaniam

customer_reviews.title: Hate buying printers, loved this one
customer_reviews.text: I usually consider buying an inkjet to be a "tax" of sorts - you buy a cheap printer and pay through the nose for ink. This printer has been very good to us. It's lasted, and worked, and the photocopier was perfect for homeschool use.
customer_reviews.author: Justin D. Long

customer_reviews.title: Worked just as I had hoped it would.
customer_reviews.text: I have always liked Canon printers, but have had trouble in the past with wireless functionality (not with Canon, just in general). I was warned by other reviews to take my time and expect that the wireless setup might be a little complicated, but I followed the instructions and had no trouble at all. (I'm using a Toshiba A505 with Windows 7 and a 64-bit platform.) Scanner, fax, and print functions have all performed beautifully. I haven't used it long enough to comment on everything (need to see how long the ink lasts, e.g.), but have been very happy so far.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen B. Burgess

customer_reviews.title: Printhead doesn't last
customer_reviews.text: This printer worked excellent for nearly two years. Then one day the printer gave an error code indicating the printhead was damaged. It would cost $75-100 to replace the printhead. I'm disappointed that the printhead has gone bad and is so costly to replace.
customer_reviews.author: Michele

product_meta.title: Canon PIXMA MX860 Wireless All-In-One office Printer
product_meta.description:
This Canon PIXMA MX860 Wireless wonder lets you print from any room in your home and boasts incredible 9600 x 2400 maximum color dpi with 1pl and a 5 individual ink tank system. A built-in, fully integrated 35-sheet Auto Document Feeder means fast copying or scanning of your originals so you can tend to other tasks while the printer is at work. Its built-in Auto Duplex Printing prints 2-sided documents without having to manually flip the pages. Additionally, various security features like password protected PDF’s means you can feel safe about the creation and distribution of your most confidential files. A Super G3 High-speed Fax along with networkable Ethernet means every aspect of your business can run as efficiently as possible. Thanks to Dual Color Gamut Processing Technology your copies will maintain the integrity of the original while you produce remarkable scans with 4800 dpi. With computer-less printing capabilities via compatible memory cards, PictBridge and optional Bluetooth your images are easy to view with a 2.5 inch LCD. Its versatile feature set also makes for a top-of-the-line photo lab so all of your printing needs are met in one machine that can virtually fit anywhere whether you’re on a PC or Mac.

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
Wireless Office All-In-One Printer with 2.5" LCD & Built-in Two-sided copying and printing
feature_bullets: Fully-Integrated 35-sheet Auto Document Feeder for rapid built-in two-sided document copying and scanning
Super G3 High-speed fax with memory to store 100 coded speed dials and up to 250 incoming pages when receiving ITU-T No. 1 Chart
Various security features including password protected PDFs
Max Printing Resolution up to 600 x 600 dpi (mono) / up to 9600 x 2400 dpi (color)
Max Printing Speed up to 8.4 ipm (mono) / up to 5.6 ipm (color)

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.9 out of 5 stars687 ratings3.9 out of 5 stars
